alert.note: Alert for Harris; Liberty; Montgomery; San Jacinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 10:02AM CST until January 28 at 7:30AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... East Fork San Jacinto at Cleveland affecting Liberty, Montgomery, Harris and San Jacinto Counties. East Fork San Jacinto near New Caney affecting Liberty, Montgomery and Harris Counties. For the East Fork San Jacinto River...including Cleveland, New Caney...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...East Fork San Jacinto at Cleveland. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:50 AM CST Thursday the stage was 127.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:50 AM CST Thursday was 127.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.3 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun East Fork San Jacinto Cleveland 19.0 127.0 Thu 9 am CST 20.1 19.4 18.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening.late tonight at 415 AM CST.
